designScenario.name: Generator System
designScenario.description: Design a high-reliability Generator System for aircraft applications, responsible for converting mechanical energy from engines into regulated AC and DC electrical power, ensuring uninterrupted power generation under varying flight conditions and engine speeds. The system must interface with the Electrical Power System to supply conditioned power to avionics, flight controls, and cabin systems.

details.description: Generate AC power at 115V 400Hz compliant with MIL-STD-704 standards for aircraft systems.
Include rectifiers and inverters to provide isolated DC and variable AC outputs for diverse subsystems.
Ensure seamless power transfer between multiple generators during engine start or failure.
Maintain output voltage stability within ±2% during engine speed fluctuations from idle to maximum RPM.
Achieve transient response recovery time of less than 200ms for sudden load changes mimicking rapid actuation of control surfaces.
Implement over-speed protection to prevent mechanical failure during engine overspeed conditions.
Include thermal protection mechanisms to shut down the generator in case of winding overheating.
Adhere to MIL-STD-810G for vibration and shock resistance in engine nacelle environments.
Ensure electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) with avionics to avoid signal interference.

systemComponents.name: Engine-Driven Generator
systemComponents.description: Primary component converting mechanical rotational energy from aircraft engines into electrical power via electromagnetic induction.

subComponents.name: Stator Assembly
subComponents.description: Stationary coil assembly generating alternating magnetic fields to induce voltage.

subComponents.name: Rotor Assembly
subComponents.description: Rotating armature driven by the engine, housing field coils for magnetic flux generation.

subComponents.name: Exciter Module
subComponents.description: Provides regulated DC excitation current to the rotor field coils for voltage control.

systemComponents.name: Voltage Regulation Module
systemComponents.description: Regulates output voltage stability and adjusts excitation current based on load conditions.

subComponents.name: Voltage Regulator
subComponents.description: Microprocessor-based controller maintaining output voltage within specified tolerances.

subComponents.name: Current Sensor Array
subComponents.description: Monitors output current to detect overloads and phase imbalances.

systemComponents.name: Frequency Stabilization Unit
systemComponents.description: Maintains 400Hz output frequency despite engine speed variations through phase-locked loop technology.

systemComponents.name: Power Conversion Hub
systemComponents.description: Manages conversion between AC and DC outputs using solid-state inverters and rectifiers.

subComponents.name: DC Output Rectifier
subComponents.description: Converts 115V AC to regulated DC outputs for avionics.

subComponents.name: Isolation Transformer
subComponents.description: Ensures galvanic isolation between generator windings and aircraft power bus.

systemComponents.name: Generator Control Unit (GCU)
systemComponents.description: Manages generator startup, shutdown, and fault diagnostics via digital interface.

subComponents.name: Digital Signal Processor (DSP)
subComponents.description: Processes real-time sensor data for closed-loop control.

subComponents.name: Fault Logic Board
subComponents.description: Implements protection algorithms for fault isolation and shutdown.

relationships.description: The Voltage Regulation Module adjusts excitation current based on generator output feedback.
The Frequency Stabilization Unit compensates for engine speed variations to maintain output frequency.
The GCU monitors and controls the Power Conversion Hub's output parameters.
The Power Conversion Hub receives regulated voltage from the Voltage Regulation Module.
The GCU integrates frequency stabilization data into overall system diagnostics.

attributes.name: ratedPowerOutput
attributes.description: Maximum continuous power output capacity of the generator under standard operating conditions.

attributes.name: outputFrequency
attributes.description: Regulated AC output frequency compliant with aircraft electrical systems standards.

attributes.name: operatingSpeedRange
attributes.description: Engine rotational speed range over which the generator maintains stable power output.

attributes.name: thermalProtectionThreshold
attributes.description: Maximum winding temperature at which the generator initiates thermal shutdown.

attributes.name: complianceStandards
attributes.description: Aviation standards the generator system is certified against for environmental and electrical performance.

comments.body: Manages AC power generation, regulation, and distribution for aircraft systems
